organ.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a part of the body, such as the heart or lungs, that has a particular purpose
organ.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: the liver, heart, and other internal organs
loss of blood flow to his vital organs
Extra doses of the hormone caused the animals’ reproductive organs to develop sooner than usual.
In Arizona, 480 people are waiting for organ transplants.
dying people who have agreed to be organ donors
organ.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a penis – used because you want to avoid saying this directly
organ.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a large musical instrument used especially in churches, with keys like a piano and large pipes that air passes through to produce the sound
organ.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: an electronic musical instrument that produces music similar to a pipe organ, but that does not have pipes
organ.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: an organization that is part of, or works for, a larger organization or group
organ.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: The courts are organs of government.
organ.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a newspaper or magazine which gives information, news etc for an organization or group
organ.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: the official organ of the Communist Party
organ.translation[0].note_box[0].section: She died after suffering serious damage to internal organs.
Luckily, the bullet passed through his body without hitting vital organs.
the male and female sexual organs
Our minds function through the brain, nervous system, and sense organs.
As with the other sensory organs, taste is highly developed in babies at birth.
a disorder of the digestive organs
There is a chronic shortage of donor organs.
Up to 5,000 people are waiting for an organ transplant.
Not all patients who die are suitable as organ donors.
organ.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a magazine or newspaper which presents the ideas and opinions of a political party or other organization
organ.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: These newspapers were essentially house organs for political factions.
a copy of the McDonald’s Corp. in-house organ (=magazine that it produces for its own employees)
organ.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: an organization that does a particular kind of work for the government or another organization or group
organ.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: an overall accrual of power to the central organs of state
The International Court of Justice is the principal judicial organ of the UN.
